job_title: Behavioral Health Therapist in Erie, PA
pros: Flexibility, supportive staff, collaborative, good training, focused on staff self-care and supporting passions
cons: Long hours, quantity-driven and productivity compensation over merit and quality of work

pros: Friendly people. Flexible hours. Get to help kids.
cons: It is a bit disorganized at times.
Poor management, understaffed, toxic work environment

pros: Its a lot of money all the time

review_title: Build your career and make a positive difference in the community!
pros: Sarah Reed provides an excellent work-life balance, supportive and collaborative team environment, opportunities for movement/promotion within the organization, ongoing training and outstanding benefits.  If you want to work for an organization that is truly making a positive difference in the lives of chidren and families, then this is the right place for you.  Your coworkers/collegues will be professionals with service hearts.  We work together to provide a safe, caring and supportive environment for our clients.  It's a unique place to work that leaves you with a sense of pride at the end of the day because you have had the opportunity to help.  Sarah Reed is the longest standing social services organization in the city of Erie and it's expanding.  That means there will be more opportunities for employees to grow their careers.  Great place to work!
cons:
As with any non-profit, Sarah Reed strives to increase minimum entry rates for direct care positions.  They have made progress with this at the residential facility and that positive change will probably continue into other programs.  They have listened and are responding, so that is great! 
Direct care positions are high-stress jobs, but there is a lot of support and promotion of self-care.

Horrific pay, give a 3℅ raise though not every year and it's only three percent of what your starting rate was when you started anyways so every year it is a smaller and smaller increase.  Poor management.  Lack of resources.  Do not follow PDE guidelines for education at all.  I've watched supervisors change grades from F's to D's dozens of times for no other reason than to make the program seem successful on paper. No opportunity for growth within the company.

pros: Helping Children. Team environment. Supportive Staff
It was rewarding working with the kids.
cons: Pay was a bit low, not able to take the kids outside of the campus
